statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: California 82, Southern 63
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- Richard Midgley scored a career-high 26 points as California beat Southern 82-63 on Tuesday in the first-ever meeting between the two teams. Marquise Kately added 14 points and a career-high 11 rebounds for California (2-1.) The Bears won despite losing starting point guard Ayinde Ubaka to a foot injury in the first half. Ubaka, who has started 26 of 28 games as a freshman last season, had five points and six assists before getting hurt. He spent the entire second half on crutches and was scheduled to be X-rayed. Peter Cipriano scored 14 points and grabbed 11 rebounds for Southern (2-1.) Trayvean Scott added 12 points for the Jaguars, who were without their top player. Deon Saunders, the Southwestern Athletic Conference's preseason Player of the Year, underwent minor knee surgery in September and isn't expected to return to the lineup for at least another two weeks. Midgley sank his first six 3-point attempts of the game, five coming in the first half including a buzzer-beater just before halftime that gave the Bears a 40-27 lead. Southern scored the first two points of the game but missed nine of its next 10 shots and never recovered. The Jaguars, who averaged 75 points in their first two games, shot just 37 percent from the floor in the first half, 41.8 percent overall.
